answerText: DNA sequencing[10] In Sanger sequencing, DNA polymerase is used to create chains of DNA of varying lengths until one of these nucleotides is added, terminating the chain. Gel electrophoresis is then used to separate the chains and obtain the sequence.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 5 | 14 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Methods of performing this process "by synthesis" include one method which uses ATP sulfurylase to convert luciferin to oxyluciferin, producing different amounts of light depending on which nucleotide is added. [10] Name this process performed by the Human Genome Project to determine the exact nucleotide makeup of human DNA.
